forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 1 to 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As the early morning in Downtown San Francisco drapes itself in a cloak of moist, cool air, a faint hint of rain lingers in the atmosphere, heralding a possible shower that may grace the city in the hours to come. The overall scene is dominated by a grayish hue, casting a subdued light over the iconic landscape, with temperatures hovering gently around the mid-forties, hinting at a brisk start to the day. The slight breeze from the west nudges against your skin, reminding you to wrap yourself in something warm yet breathable.

As you venture into the day, anticipate the clouds to thicken, and the chance of rain amplifies as the clock advances towards the afternoon. The cityscape may seem less vivid, shrouded partially in a marine layer, with hints of fog softening the outlines of familiar structures. One might consider the practicality of donning layers, perhaps a cozy sweater beneath a light waterproof jacket, to adapt gracefully to the shifting conditions. A walk along the Embarcadero could be a serene choice, marred only by the occasional sprinkle, offering glimpses of energy as people flow through the streets, with the faint scent of fresh coffee wafting from nearby cafes.

Today may not present the sunniest of dispositions, but the charm of the city remains unblemished. With the day unfolding under the gentle grip of overcast skies, this could be the perfect opportunity to settle into a snug corner at your favorite coffee shop, enjoying a good book as the world moves rhythmically outside.
